Name: Alchemy Kit
Description: Alchemy is the capability to transform base materials into precious potions.  Collect materials, make potion bases, and turn those into potions that can heal and improve your allies, or hurt your enemies.  Very high complexity.

Name: Art Kit
Description: Covering non-performance arts, such as painting, sculpting, clayworking, woodcarving, engraving, dance, drawing, opera, ballet, calligraphy, or writing.  Artists spend rests creating and refining works of art that give one-time bonuses or can be sold for a high price.  Medium complexity.

Name: Artisan Kit
Description: Covering medium-sized artisanry like leatherworking, bookbinding, cobbling, weaving, glassblowing, ceramics, woodcarving, furring, ropemaking, dying, hatting, and so on.  Artisans can craft, repair, and modify items relevant to their specialization.  Simple complexity.

Name: Botany Kit
Description: Botanists forage, gather, and apply herbs and medicines to targets directly with delayed effects.  Not effective in dangerous moments, but greatly so before and after.  High complexity.

Name: Building Kit
Description: Builders can create structures, buildings, and fortifications, over rests, creating or destroying long-lasting structures at their will.  Low complexity.

Name: Cooking Kit
Description: Cooks prepare meals and drinks for their party to keep them full and happy, giving bonuses over rests.  They can attempt to brew alcohol over long rests that can give bonuses to a rest based on how well it is brewed.

Name: Entertainment Kit
Description: Covering performance trades, such as dance, theatre, gaming, musical instruments, singing, puppetry, comedy, and street magic.  Entertainers enrapture crowds, controlling public perception of situations and playing off other people’s expectations to draw in attention and to clear people’s heads.

Name: Pathfinding Kit
Description: Pathfinders map and explore environments, finding safe paths through them and better understanding the environment around them.

Name: Smithing Kit
Description: Smiths, which can be specialized as armorers, blacksmith, bladesmith, or gunsmith (if applicable to the campaign), can spend rests forging metal into arms and armor, as well as upkeep their weapons.

Name: Subterfuge Kit
Description: Those capable in the subterfuge trade can create disguises, mimic voices and behaviors, hide hidden messages, and create forgeries.

Name: Thievery Kit
Description: Professional thieves are capable in misdirection and theft of all sorts, including lockpicking, pick pocketing, and setting and disarming traps.

Name: Tinkering Kit
Description: Tinkerers can create minor trinkets, as well as more complex gadgets that can be modified to your liking over rests.  Tinkerers can also repair construct allies.
